name: stratO
description: Glide, swoop, tuck, dive, magnetize, grind, walldrive, and burn your way through rings to advance the difficulty of the vast, procedurally-generated environment while avoiding the fog and getting stranded! This game demands a great deal of skill and is not suited for casual players or people susceptible to motion sickness.

reviews.review_text: My stratO experience is one of the more unique experiences with a steam game.  I started out confused and frustrated. I went to the forums and complained about the lack of tutorial and how confusing the controls were.  One of the forum moderators added me almost instantly, walked me through some of the basics, watched a broadcast of me playing, and then had me watch a broadcast of him playing. After that, I kind of knew what was goin on, but still felt lost.  Then the developer himself got on the forums and posted a 22 minute comprehensive tutorial. I watched the whole thing and after my next flight I got my first achievement.  1.3 hours of gameplay later, after all of that, I still feel like a complete n00b, and am still very lost as to what I'm doing when playing, but I'm starting to figure it out little by little.  And, with each little bit I figure out, I'm more and more impressed by how groundbreaking this game is.  I am going to recommend this game, but with the warning that if you're not ready to go through a serious amount of learning just to figure out the basics, this might not be worth your time.  However, if you're craving something new and insanely challenging, buy this now.  Also, I'd like to point out that the dev and moderator who helped me are two of the nicest and most patient people I've come across on Steam, and should get a medal just for dealing with crazy people like me :)
